channel.title: Rei's MiniMap Mod
channel.description:
Have you guys heard of this minimap mod by [b][i]ReiFNSK[/i][/b], it's pretty amazing, has a nice clean interface and allows you to set [b]multiple[/b] different color coded "waypoint" markers. It's really well made and doesn't cause any problems that I am aware of in 1.2.5. Though I am having problems with 1.3.2 and [i]I[/i] don't correlate these problems directly with this mod [font=times new roman]but who knows[/font], it might be the issue.
Installation is straightforward and a modloader is needed.
Link: http://www.minecraftforum.net/topic/482147-132125-aug17-reis-minimap-v32-05/
To open the minecraft.jar file, I use 7-zip. They have official releases for some OS's and some unofficial releases for other OS's not directly supported.
Link: http://www.7-zip.org/download.html
To find the minecraft folder Link: http://mineboard.org/thread-how-to-get-to-the-minecraft-folder
On the original thread for the mod, you can find previous versions.

item.title: Rei's MiniMap Mod
item.dc:creator: @triston001 triston001
item.description:
@triston001 wrote:

i believe cave mapping works by makings a lighter green marking for wherever there is air blocks close to the surface, but also under normal blocks.
and yea, i was thinking about making a thread for the hell of it, but figured we all used it anyway. i’ve used one since 1.8.1

Read full topic

item.description:
@xxx123xxx wrote:

omgilikepie:

Lots of people on here use it, and I’ve never had to use a mod loader with it :o

That’s cool dude, I didn’t know that. And I didn’t know people knew about this mod. Since I saw no thread about it, I thought it would be nice to share.
